v.v: Remember, Yahweh, what has happened to us;
Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers;
We have become orphans, the fatherless,
We must pay silver for the water we drink,
Those who are coming after us are close behind us;
We have given ourselves to Egypt and to Assyria
Our fathers sinned, and they are no more,
Slaves rule over us,
We get our bread only by risking our lives,
Our skin has grown as hot as an oven
Women are raped in Zion,
Princes are hung up by their own hands,
Young men are forced to grind grain with a millstone,
The elders have left the city gate,
The joy of our heart has ceased
The crown has fallen from our head;
For this our heart has become sick,
for Mount Zion lies desolate, with jackals prowling over it.
But you, Yahweh, reign forever,
Why do you forget us forever?
Restore us to yourself, Yahweh, and we will be restored.
unless you have utterly rejected us

v: look and see our disgrace.
our houses to foreigners.
and our mothers are like widows.
and we must pay silver to get our own wood.
we are weary and we can find no rest.
to get enough food.
and we bear their iniquities.
and there is no one to deliver us from their hand.
because of the sword in the wilderness.
because of the burning heat of hunger.
and virgins in the cities of Judah.
and no honor is shown to the elders.
and boys stagger under heavy loads of wood.
and the young men have left their music.
and our dancing has turned into mourning.
woe to us, for we have sinned!
for these things our eyes grow dim
and you will sit upon your throne from generation to generation.
Why do you forsake us for the length of your days?
Renew our days as they were long agoâ€”
and you are angry with us beyond measure.
